intro: Acosta besseriana, commonly known as the golden bell vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces long, pendulous flower clusters that resemble bells, hence its common name. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Acosta besseriana is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees.
